docs.snippet: Interviews, documents and legal records show that when the most senior Rutgers officials learned details about Mike Rice’s behavior toward players, they ignored them or issued light penalties....
docs.lead_paragraph: Interviews, documents and legal records show that when the most senior Rutgers officials learned details about Mike Rice’s behavior toward players, they ignored them or issued light penalties.
docs.abstract: Interviews, documents and legal records show that when senior-most Rutgers officials learned details about men's basketball coach Mike Rice's behavior toward players, they ignored them or issued light penalties; reveal culture in which university was far more concerned with protecting itself from legal action than with protecting its students from abusive coach.

headline.seo: Rutgers Officials Long Knew of Coach Mike Rice’s Abusive Behavior
headline.main: Rutgers Officials Long Knew of Coach’s Actions
headline.print_headline: Rutgers Officials Long Knew of Coach’s Actions

docs.snippet: The Knicks, the N.B.A.’s oldest team, use more than 35 pounds of ice after some games, but Pablo Prigioni, a 35-year-old rookie from Argentina, does not partake....
docs.lead_paragraph: The Knicks, the N.B.A.’s oldest team, use more than 35 pounds of ice after some games, but Pablo Prigioni, a 35-year-old rookie from Argentina, does not partake.
docs.abstract: Profile of New York Knicks 35-year-old point guard Pablo Prigioni, who counts on diet, exercise and adequate sleep for recovery purposes rather than ice; Prigioni has been the most durable of the older players the team signed in the off-season,  avoiding any significant injury.

headline.seo: When the Knicks’ Pablo Prigioni Recovers, He Prefers to Forgo Ice
headline.main: On an Aching Roster, a Knick Prefers to Forgo Ice
headline.print_headline: On an Aching Roster, a Knick Prefers to Forgo Ice

docs.abstract: Profiles of Louisville women's basketball teammates and sisters Shoni and Jude Schimmel, who belong to the Confederated Tribes of the Umatilla in eastern Oregon; Schimmel sisters have become indispensable members of the Louisville's team, which is preparing to face California at the Final Four in New Orleans.

headline.seo: Final Four — For Louisville, American Indian Sisters Inspire
headline.main: Far From Reservation, Sisters Lead Louisville
headline.print_headline: Far From Reservation, Sisters Lead Louisville
